goal: Perform a structured peer review of another AI system’s bug and reliability assessment for a given service, and produce a unified prioritized revision.

expected_input.service_directory: Absolute path to the target service directory (provided externally).

steps.title: Review Agent Rules
steps.instruction: Review the agent rules at `docs/ai_agents/agent_rules.md` and follow instructions.

steps.title: Load Assessments
steps.instruction: Look in the same directory as the peer review spec. Review all the markdown files which you did not author.

steps.title: Compare Findings
steps.instruction: Identify what the peer caught that you missed and vice versa, citing file/line or issue type.

steps.title: Evaluate Priorities
steps.instruction: Assess the peer’s severity ratings and immediate fixes ordering; propose any reordering with justification.

steps.title: Challenge Risky Recommendations
steps.instruction: Flag any fixes that may introduce regressions or premature architectural changes. Suggest safer alternatives.

steps.title: Identify Missed Reliability Issues
steps.instruction: Surface critical edge cases, data-integrity risks, and monitoring gaps that neither review covered.

steps.title: Synthesize Updated Assessment
steps.instruction: Focus on 3–5 most critical data-loss/corruption risks, highest-ROI reliability fixes, and quick wins.

steps.title: Score Peer Review
steps.instruction: Apply the required 0–5 scoring across metrics with brief evidence, as per the scaffold.

steps.title: Save v2 File
steps.instruction: Write `[agent_name]_assessment_v2_[timestamp].md` to the same directory as the peer review spec, following the scaffold at `output_template`.

notes: Prioritize production reliability and data integrity over code aesthetics.
Use clear Markdown, fenced code blocks for diffs/commands.
Explicitly state if both assessments are fully aligned.
